location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is requesting permission to apply to the Military Department for permission to 'proceed beyond the limits of the [Bombay] Presidency', via a streamer bound for Suez. It cites long service and poor health as the reason for the request. It further reports that the Persian Gulf is in a tranquil state, and that the Arabian Coast is increasingly prosperous.The Resident also uses the opportunity to outline the good service of Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball in his role as Assistant Resident, and Acting Political Agent in Turkish Arabia.
